articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Show Sincerity for Improving Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Show Sincerity for Improving Inter-Korean Relations
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Recently the south Korean authorities vociferated about achieving the reconciliation and unity between the north and the south and repairing the relations through "confidence-building" in each public appearance.
					 They called for resuming the north-south high-level contact as early as possible, asserting that "the improvement of the relations" is urgent.
					
					 A spokesman for the north side's delegation to the north-south high-level contact in a statement on Saturday termed this nothing but a hypocritical act of mocking at the nation and deceiving the world.
					
					 This is evidenced by the anti-DPRK psychological campaigns including ever-more undisguised leaflet scattering operations, the statement noted, and went on: The south Korean authorities have become evermore frantic in their anti-DPRK leaflet scattering operations.
					
					 They are driving the present inter-Korean relations into a deeper mire of catastrophe.
					
					 We have already declared solemnly that the scattering of leaflets is the most undisguised practice of the psychological warfare, a gross violation of the national agreement, an open confrontation with the DPRK and an action to provoke a war against it.
					
					 The south side will find no excuse even in case the Korean People's Army deals a retaliatory blow at any target any time to frustrate the "balloon operation".
					
					 The KPA does not hide the fact that it is determined to wipe out "the source of psychological warfare and forces supporting and commanding it" at once in case the leaflet scattering operation kicks off.
					
					 The north-south relations can never be improved by empty words and deceptive wordplays.
					
					 It is a great historic cause of the nation which can be accomplished only through sincere practical actions.
					
					 It is crystal clear to all that the north-south relations can never be mended with such stand and attitude as throwing away like a pair of old shoes even the agreement reached with the special mandate given by the top leader as what is happening at present.
					
					 It is the primary requirement for improving the inter-Korean ties to uproot the south Korean authorities' true colors as diehard confrontation elements.
					
					 In other words, they should halt before anything else such anti-DPRK psychological warfare as leaflet-scattering operations at once.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should not forget that their priority task is to have elementary decency to appear before the north's delegates before repeatedly calling for the above-said contact.
					
					 We would like to reassure them that the door will automatically open for the dialogue between the north and the south if such actions of confrontation as leaflet-scattering operations stop. 
					
					 We will continue to closely follow the attitude of the south Korean authorities.

articles.title: Report on Human Rights Situation in DPRK Released
articles.content:
Report on Human Rights Situation in DPRK Released
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- A report of the DPRK Association for Human Rights Studies was released on Saturday amid concern and expectation of the public at home and abroad. It reflects the characteristics of the socialist system, human rights policy pursued in the DPRK and the actual human rights performance in the country.
					 The world is showing increasing concern for human rights issue and there are widespread actions for genuine human rights in all fabrics of social life.
					
					 What is getting all the more undisguised on the international arena at present are political pressures on specified countries and attempts at interference in the internal affairs of those countries by abusing the inviolable human rights. A typical example is the vicious human rights racket against the DPRK.
					
					 The hostile forces are persistently peddling the "human rights issue" in the DPRK in a bid to tarnish its image and bring down the social system and ideology chosen by the Korean people. They are becoming all the more undisguised in these moves as the days go by.
					
					 Wild rumors and fictions about the DPRK are afloat in the international community due to the hostile forces' despicable human rights racket to slander and hurt the DPRK.
					
					 Under this situation the DPRK Association for Human Rights Studies released a report on human rights performance in the country to help the public properly know about the efforts exerted by the DPRK to protect and promote human rights and about the actual human rights performance and lay bare the false and reactionary nature of the reckless anti-DPRK "human rights" racket kicked up by the hostile forces and thus wipe out the prejudice and misunderstanding.
					
					 The five-chapter all-inclusive report was worked out with the cooperation among several domestic institutions and NGO organizations, academic institutions and human rights experts in various fields.
					
					 The first chapter deals with the ideological foundation of the state human rights system as regards the human rights system in the DPRK and the course of its formation and development.
					
					 The second chapter deals with all legal and practical measures taken by the state after the foundation of the country to guarantee the rights of people and protect and promote them and human rights enjoyed by the citizens.
					
					 The third and fourth chapters deal with the stand and efforts made by the DPRK for human rights in the world and major difficulties lying in the way of guaranteeing human rights in the DPRK.
					
					 The fifth chapter deals with data studied by the Association as regards the prospect for guaranteeing human rights in the DPRK.
					
					 As mentioned in the report, the DPRK has consistently enforced policies for the people from the very day of its foundation on the principle of putting the rights and interests of the popular masses above all and making them absolute and has exerted every possible effort to guarantee the people genuine rights.
					
					 All the people in the DPRK, therefore, feel proud of the world's most advantageous human rights system and policies such as universal compulsory education, free medical care and free provision of housings that are enforced in the country, and are striving hard to defend and further consolidate the man-centered socialist system.
					
					 By clearly reflecting the human rights system and situation in the DPRK, the report proves that the anti-DPRK human rights campaign of the U.S. and hostile forces is acts detrimental to guaranteeing and promoting the rights of the people.
					
					 The report also clarifies the efforts and stand of the DPRK on international cooperation for promoting human rights.
					
					 Consistent is the stand of the DPRK to have genuine dialogue and cooperation in the field of human rights and contribute to promoting human rights in the world. The DPRK has never opposed dialogue on human rights but maintained the stand to have a candid exchange of views with the countries truly concerned for the human rights issue.
					
					 But genuine human rights dialogue and cooperation have not been effected due to those forces abusing the human rights issue as a means for attaining such sinister politically-motivated purposes as interference in internal affairs and overturn of social systems.
					
					 The release of the study report on the human rights situation in the country is an indication of its will to creditably fulfill its responsibility in the field of human rights and a positive measure to promote international cooperation.
					
					 The report will help clearly understand how false and unrealistic the rumors about the DPRK floated by hostile forces on the basis of fabrications.
					
					 The major source of misinformation about human rights performance in the DPRK are "testimonies" notably made by anti-DPRK fanatics who defected from the north. Those who cook up groundless stories about human rights to get a petty amount of money are without exception criminals who fled to the south for fear of facing a legal punishment after committing indelible crimes in their hometowns and immoral guys who are disqualified to talk about human rights.
					
					 Their inhuman nature will be disclosed sooner or later.
					
					 Whoever echoes what was uttered by the riff-raffs even after reading the report released by the Association must be imbeciles lacking the ability to judge the reality or tricksters seeking to attain sinister purposes even by making far-fetched assertions.
					
					 The U.S. and other Western countries should not pull up the DPRK over its human rights but face up to the situation as it is and repent of their own poor human rights records.
					
					 The DPRK will continue to exert its utmost efforts to foil the anti-DPRK human rights campaign of the hostile forces and meet all their challenges, step up the peaceful economic construction, steadily improve the people's living standard and thus provide the people with better conditions for enjoying their rights.
					
					 The report will help set right the wrong views by widely introducing the DPRK's human rights policies and situation and contribute to promoting genuine cooperation in the field of human rights.
					
					 The full text of the report is posted on www.kcna.kp and www.naenara.com, internet homepages.

articles.title: Association for Human Rights Studies Spokesman on Report on Human Rights Performance in DPRK
articles.content:
Association for Human Rights Studies Spokesman on Report on Human Rights Performance in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Association for Human Rights Studies Saturday gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA as regards a report on the human rights policy pursued in the DPRK and its human rights mechanism:
					 A report of the DPRK Association for Human Rights Studies was released amid concern and expectation of the public at home and abroad. It reflects the characteristics of the socialist system of the DPRK, its human rights policy and actual human rights performance.
					
					 The U.S. and its followers, steeped in repugnancy toward the DPRK, faked up an "investigation committee", not content with pulling up it over its "human rights issue". They prodded the "committee" into releasing a "report" based on false data cooked up by riff-raffs, further intensifying the anti-DPRK "human rights" campaign.
					
					 The report made public by the "Committee for Investigating Human Rights Situation in Korea" is no more than a dead document as it is peppered with "testimonies" made by swindlers who "defected from the north," speculation and enmity, not mentioning the human rights policy and mechanisms in the DPRK.
					
					 Now that the hostile forces are abusing the human rights issue to tarnish the image of the dignified DPRK and emasculate the idea and social system chosen by the Korean people, the Association released the report to probe the truth and properly inform the world of the actual human rights performance in the DPRK.
					
					  The report gives historical, comprehensive and systemic account of all consistent efforts made by the DPRK to let the people enjoy genuine human rights while giving top priority to the rights and interests of the popular people and absolutizing them since its foundation. It also discloses that the anti-DPRK human rights campaign by the U.S. and other hostile forces is an act of encroaching upon the human rights of the people of the DPRK.
					
					 The report also clarifies the DPRK's stand on the international cooperation for protecting and promoting human rights.
					
					 What the DRPK has opposed is the human rights dialogue which was used by some states as a means to realize their vicious political purposes such as interference in other's internal affairs and act to topple governments. The DPRK has made sincere efforts for the international cooperation in the field of human rights.
					
					 The report was worked out with positive cooperation among domestic institutions, NGOs, academic organizations, human rights experts in various fields and individual citizens of the DPRK. It will be conducive to make the world have a clear understanding of the DPRK's human rights policy and mechanisms and know about the deceptive and reactionary nature of the anti-DPRK human rights campaign by the hostile forces.
					
					 The DPRK will as ever do its best to lay bare and frustrate the anti-DPRK human rights campaign by the hostile forces and provide the people with better conditions to enjoy human rights, and promote the international dialogue and cooperation for ensuring the genuine human rights.

articles.title: Reply Message to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
articles.content:
Reply Message to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a reply message from Bashar Al-Assad, president of the Syrian Arab Republic, on September 9.
					 The message said:
					
					 I express thanks to Your Excellency for sending warm congratulations to me on my 49th birthday and wish you and your family good health and happiness and the friendly Korean people greater progress and prosperity.
					
					 I highly estimate your support for the Syrian Arab people's struggle to achieve the peace and stability of the country.
					
					 Please accept my highest regards.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Communist Political Party of Norway
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Communist Political Party of Norway
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift by the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 It was handed over to an official concerned by Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the party on a visit to the DPRK, on Sept. 11.

articles.title: Congratulatory Messages, Letters to Kim Jong Un from Different Countries
articles.content:
Congratulatory Messages, Letters to Kim Jong Un from Different Countries
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received congratulatory messages and letters from different countries on the occasions of the 54th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership and the 69th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 They included the general secretary of the C.C., the Lebanese Communist Party, chairman of the Communist Party of Germany, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, chairman of the Party for Socialist Choice of Romania, chairman of the C.C., the Party of Communists of Russia, general secretary and the international secretary of the New Yugoslav Communist Party, chairman of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) and the vice-chairman who doubles as international secretary of the party, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, chairman of the Arab Socialist Party of Egypt and the chairman of the C.C., the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico.
					
					 Also among them were the secretary of the C.C., the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks, deputy general secretary of the National Democratic Congress of Ghana, vice-chairman of the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt, director general of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea and other high-ranking officials of the political, social and economic circles in Lebanon, Syria, Pakistan, Kazakhstan, Iran, Germany, Romania, Russia, Belarus, Switzerland, UK, Austria, Benin, Mexico and Ecuador and representatives of international organizations, Juche idea study organizations, organizations for supporting Korea's reunification and friendly organizations.

articles.title: WPK Delegation Visits Belgium
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Visits Belgium
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, visited Belgium on September 9 and 10.
					 During the visit Kang respectively met and had conversations with the chairman of the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the European Parliament, the vice-president for External Relations of the Group of Social Parties of the European Parliament, the assistant general secretary for External Relations of the Party of European Socialists and other personages concerned of the European Parliament and the European Union.
					
					 At the conversations they had exchange of views on the issues of mutual concern including the issue of developing the relations between the DPRK and the EU.

articles.title: Large Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy in Phnom Penh from Cambodian King, Great Queen
articles.content:
Large Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy in Phnom Penh from Cambodian King, Great Queen
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni and Great Queen Norodom Monineath Sihanouk respectively sent large floral baskets to the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh on September 9, the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The floral baskets were laid before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Posters of 14th Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival Produced
articles.content:
Posters of 14th Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival Produced
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Posters of the 14th Pyongyang International Film Festival were produced on the occasion of the festival.
					 Printed on a poster are the logo of the festival, the letters bearing "The 14th Pyongyang International Film Festival" and "Welcome" and five colored tapes.
					
					 The poster welcomes foreign friends coming to Pyongyang, the host of the festival, with friendship towards the Korean people.
					
					 There is also a poster portraying a pigeon and bearing words "Independence", "Peace" and "Friendship" reflecting the desire of mankind to lead a happy life in a peaceful world free from war.

articles.title: Stamp Show of Philatelists of DPRK and Russia Closes
articles.content:
Stamp Show of Philatelists of DPRK and Russia Closes
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- A stamp show of philatelists of the DPRK and Russia closed with due ceremony at the Korean Stamp Museum on Saturday under the co-sponsorship of the Korean Union of Philatelists and the Russian National Philatelists Academy to mark the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Present at the ceremony were Kim Yong Gil, chairman of the Korean Union of Philatelists, Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, officials concerned, working people and philatelists in the city.
					
					 Also present there were members of the delegation of the Russian National Philatelists Academy headed by President Andrei Strygin, Ambassador Alexandr Timonin and staff members of the Russian embassy here.
					
					 Certificates, medals, participation certificates and honorary member certificates of the Russian National Philatelists Academy were awarded to philatelists and organizations of the two countries who participated in the show.
					
					 Then followed speeches.
					
					 Speakers said the show which was held amid the ever-mounting atmosphere of the traditional DPRK-Russia friendship offered an important opportunity of helping the peoples of the two countries know well about their history and culture and boosting the ties of friendship and cooperation.
					
					 They expressed expectation that multifaceted cooperation and exchange between the organs issuing stamps and philatelists organizations would grow stronger in conformity with the aspiration and desire of the governments and peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Electronic Heliograph Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Electronic Heliograph Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The Hydro-meteorological Engineering Institute in the DPRK developed an electronic heliograph.
					 Consisting of sensor and indicator, the newly-developed heliograph helps accurately observe sunrays.
					
					 Characterized by changed size and shape of radiation mirror, it is capable of resolving sunrays in one minute.
					
					 The heliograph has proved effective in the fields of hydro-meteorology and agriculture.

articles.title: Family of National Musical Instrumentalists
articles.content:
Family of National Musical Instrumentalists
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Dr. and associate Prof. Hwang Jin Chol, a teacher of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory, is noted for having made big contributions to developing rendition of national musical instruments along with his family members.
					 Hwang majors in rendition of high-pitched flute, his wife middle-sized Korean fiddle, his first daughter Korean zither and his second daughter large-sized Korean fiddle.
					
					 Hwang had been a violinist and his wife pianist before they began learning national musical instruments in July Juche 55 (1966).
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il in his lifetime enjoyed the eldest daughter Hwang Ryon A's recital of Korean zither, highly appreciating her rendition.
					
					 The second daughter Hwang Na Yon, a student of the conservatory, came first in the 21st Individual Contest for February 16 Art Prize in February this year. It was the first time for an instrumentalist of large-sized Korean fiddle to place first in the contests.
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un saw to it that Hwang's family members took part in the 9th National Meeting of Artistes held this year.

articles.title: Minju Joson Blasts U.S. Moves to Deploy THAAD in S. Korea
articles.content:
Minju Joson Blasts U.S. Moves to Deploy THAAD in S. Korea 
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces decided to keep the south Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command" in a military base in Ryongsan, Seoul as requested by the U.S., according to a report. The U.S. and the south Korean forces have become all the more undisguised in their moves to deploy THAAD in south Korea.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Saturday says this is a dangerous military nexus to render the situation in and around the Korean peninsula extremely tense and push the north-south relations to a catastrophe.
					
					 The south Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command" is a mechanism for aggression against the DPRK. It has supervised the work for working out war scenarios against it and military drills and arms buildup for implementing them, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Key Resolve joint military exercises staged this year were also supervised by the command.
					
					 This notwithstanding, the puppet military warmongers decided to keep in Seoul the command though it was planned to be disbanded. This is a revelation of a sinister aim to keep straining the situation on the peninsula and push the north-south ties to a catastrophe in collusion with outsiders.
					
					 The U.S. has long pushed ahead with the moves to build a missile shield for the purpose of achieving its aim with ease by making preemptive strikes at countries which are obstructive to carrying out its strategy for world domination. It has worked hard to deploy THAAD in south Korea. 
					
					 The deployment of THAAD in south Korea is becoming a reality due to the puppet forces' active support for the U.S. moves.
					
					 All facts go to clearly prove that the U.S. and the puppet forces are to chiefly blame for straining the situation in and around the Korean peninsula and pushing the north-south ties to a catastrophe.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Authorities to Roll back Its Anachronistic Policy of Confrontation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Authorities to Roll back Its Anachronistic Policy of Confrontation
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- South Korean authorities are now paying lip-service to "improved south-north relations" but, in actuality, persisting in their reckless acts of fostering hostility and confrontation with the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in an article.
					 The south Korean regime's policy of confrontation with the DPRK is a source of bedeviling the inter-Korean ties, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities should roll back their policy of confrontation as the first step for mending the north-south relations.
					
					 Such a policy is nothing good for the Korean nation as it faithfully serves the purpose of foreign forces' policy of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities truly stand for confidence and dialogue between the north and the south, they should take the practical action to drop the anti-reunification policy of confrontation.
					
					 If they want to have dialogue, they should have negotiations for implementing the north-south declarations. If they want to have talks, they should have negotiations for substantially defusing the distrust and confrontation between the north and the south.
					
					 It is all Koreans who are responsible for resolving the issue of inter-Korean ties and defusing the tensions on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 All Koreans in the north, the south and abroad should turn out full of confidence in the struggle to frustrate the anti-reunification forces' moves for confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north and accomplish the cause of national reunification as early as possible.
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime is persistently pursuing the policy of confrontation, going against the trend of the times and the desire of all Koreans. This is as foolish an act as precipitating its ruin.

articles.title: Serious Human Rights Abuses in S. Korean Puppet Army
articles.content:
Serious Human Rights Abuses in S. Korean Puppet Army
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Serious human rights abuses are occurring in the south Korean puppet army, sparking off a serious social problem, according to broadcasting services of south Korea.
					 A 21 years-old private who was designated as "a soldier concerned" was found to have hung himself to death in a unit of the puppet army stationed in Sokcho City, south Korean Kangwon Province on September 6. Also found in his footlocker at that time was a paper on which he wrote his military service was very hard.
					
					 In June, a private of the 28th Division was severely beaten by his superior for the mere reason that he did not participate in a religious event.
					
					 The number of those who deserted from the barracks due to assault and harsh violence reached 3 000 in the past five years alone.
					
					 A sexual abuse against a woman in her twenties was committed at a guided missile brigade of the puppet air force on August 27.

articles.title: S. Korean Fishermen Hit Hard by Red Tide
articles.content:
S. Korean Fishermen Hit Hard by Red Tide
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- S. Korean fishermen were hit hard by red tide in south Korea, according to KBS of south Korea on Sept. 11.
					 A large red tide occurred in the waters off Namhae County, South Kyongsang Province on Sept. 4.
					
					 Red tide was caused by an abrupt propagation of microbe due to steady rise of high temperature and pollution of sea water. This hit hard the culture ground in the waters, leaving 1.13 million fishes dead between September 6 and 10.
					
					 Red tide occurred in the area of Kuryongpho, Phohang City, North Kyongsang Province on Sept. 10, leaving more than 70 000 fishes dead. The damages in the area reached 3 billion won.

articles.title: Russian Papers Introduce DPRK
articles.content:
Russian Papers Introduce DPRK 
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Russian papers carried special write-ups, illustrated with portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and his photos and photos of Marshal Kim Jong Un to mark the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The Sept. 3-9 issue of Pravda Primoriya in an article titled "Undying exploits of Comrade Kim Il Sung" said that one of the  feats he performed on behalf of the Korean revolution is that he built the genuine people's power speaking for the will and interests of the Korean people.
					
					 The Sept. 3 issue of Rio Panorama carried the following article under the title "Invincible socialist power":
					
					 The DPRK turned into a prospering socialist country under the guidance of its founder President Kim Il Sung and into an invincible power under the leadership of Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK is now demonstrating its might as a power as it is led by Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The DPRK will remain shining forever as an invincible socialist power.
					
					 The Sept. 3 issue of Nakhodkinski Rabochi and the Sept. 8 issue of Pri Armurskiye Wedomostsi carried articles praising the Songun leadership feats of Kim Jong Un who is glorifying the DPRK as the dignified, socialist and invincible state.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Praised by Personages of Syria, Myanmar
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Praised by Personages of Syria, Myanmar
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Personages of Syria and Myanmar issued statements on Aug. 28 and Sept. 8 on the occasion of the 66th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 Saber Ballul, head of Department of the Political Faculty of University of Damascus, said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung founded the DPRK, the first people's democratic state in the east.
					
					 The founding of the DPRK was a historical event that marked a turning point in the life of the Korean people.
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche, started by Kim Il Sung and led by Kim Jong Il, is being successfully carried forward by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The general manager of a publishing house in Myanmar noted:
					
					 Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Korean people, is leading the Korean people to the building of a thriving nation and national reunification after successfully carrying forward the idea and cause of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 I am sure that the Korean people will surely accomplish the noble cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 I send full support and solidarity to the just struggle of the Korean people.

articles.title: DPRK Founding Anniversary Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Founding Anniversary Celebrated in Different Countries
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Seminar, round-table talks, book and photo exhibitions and film shows were held in India, Mongolia and Indonesia on Sept. 3 and 4.
					
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos documenting the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were books and photos introducing the DPRK.
					
					 Films shown included Korean film "Pyongyang Today".
					
					 The chairman of the Juche Idea Study Society of Delhi, India said that the DPRK which proclaimed its foundation to the world on Sept. 9, 1948 has covered the road of victory and glory for the past 66 years.
					
					 The secretary general of the Indian Society for Juche Idea-Self-Reliance Studies noted:
					
					 Kim Il Sung, founder of socialist Korea, carried out the socialist revolution and construction in a unique manner as required by the Korean people and its specific condition, not wedded to the experience of other countries and existing formula.
					
					 The line of the Songun politics set forth by Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il by carrying forward the idea and cause of the President is the independent one for reliably defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country by its own efforts on this world in which the imperialists' aggression and arbitrary practices are getting desperate.
					
					 The DPRK will demonstrate its might as a socialist power that no one dares provoke as long as it is guided by Kim Jong Un who is invariably taking the road of independence, Songun and socialism.
					
					 The advisor to the Mongolia-Democratic Korea Friendship Bridge Association said that only victory will be in store for the Korean people invariably advancing along the road of socialism while smashing all trials and challenges.

articles.title: Visita Belgica delegacion del PTC
articles.content:
Visita Belgica delegacion del PTC
Pyongyang, 13 de septiembre (ACNC) -- La delegacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, presidida por Kang Sok Ju, miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido, cumplio los dias 9 y 10 una visita a Belgica. 
					Durante su estancia, Kang Sok Ju departio por separados con el presidente del Comite de Relaciones Exteriores del Parlamento Europeo, el vicepresidente encargado de relaciones exteriores del Grupo de Partidos Sociales del Parlamento Europeo, el subsecretario general encargo de relaciones exteriores del Partido de Socialistas Europeos y otras personalidades del Parlamento Europeo y la Union Europea. 
					
					En las ocasiones se intercambiaron las opiniones sobres los asuntos de interes mutuo, incluso el desarrollo de relaciones entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Union Europea.

articles.title: Portavoz de delegacion norcoreana exige sinceridad de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
Portavoz de delegacion norcoreana exige sinceridad de autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 13 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Ahora las autoridades surcoreanas hablan tanto en lugares publicos de que se debe lograr la reconciliacion y unidad entre ambas partes coreanas y mejorar las relaciones bilaterales mediante la "creacion de confianza". 
					Incluso preconizan la reanudacion pronta del contacto de alto nivel Norte-Sur diciendo que es apremiante el "mejoramiento de relaciones". 
					
					El portavoz de la delegacion nortena al contacto de alto nivel Norte-Sur de Corea, en su declaracion fechada 13, revelo que esos dichos no pasan de ser un acto verbal hipocrita para burlarse de la nacion y enganar al mundo, y prosiguio: 
					
					Lo evidencian el lanzamiento de volantes y otras acciones de campana psicologica contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea que van de mal en peor con el paso del tiempo. 
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas realizan febrilmente el lanzamiento de volantes de contenido anti-RPDC, debido a lo cual llegan a la fase mas critica las relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					Ya hemos advertido severamente que el lanzamiento de volantes resulta un acto de campana psicologica mas abierto que rompe los acuerdos nacionales y busca el enfrentamiento y la guerra contra la RPDC. 
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas ya no tendran nada que decir aunque se aseste en cualquier momento el ataque de venganza de nuestro ejercito contra cualquier blanco para frustrar la "operacion de globos" que transportan volantes. 
					
					No ocultamos nuestra decision de eliminar en un instante el "foco de provocacion y las fuerzas de ayuda y mando" de la guerra psicologica cuando comience nuevamente el lanzamiento de volantes. 
					
					La mejora de relaciones intercoreanas no se logra con palabras vacias sino es una gran empresa nacional que puede ser realizada con acciones sinceras. 
					
					Con la posicion y actitud de despreciar hasta el acuerdo alcanzado por el mandato especial de la direccion suprema, no se podra mejorar nunca los vinculos Norte-Sur. 
					
					Eliminar el arraigado vicio de enfrentamiento fratricida de las autoridades surcoreanas es la primera demanda para mejorar las relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					En otra palabra, ellas deben parar de inmediato la campana psicologica anti-RPDC, incluso el lanzamiento de volantes.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas deben tener presente que lo mas urgente no es demandarnos con palabras el contacto de alto nivel Norte-Sur sino tener el decoro para dialogar con nuestra parte. 
					
					Reiteramos que se reiniciara naturalmente el dialogo Norte-Sur cuando se paren las acciones en busca de enfrentamiento fratricida como las arriba referidas. 
					
					Observaremos de continuo los movimientos de las autoridades surcoreanas.

articles.title: Publicadas pancartas del XIV Festival Internacional de Cine de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Publicadas pancartas del XIV Festival Internacional de Cine de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 13 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedaron publicadas las pancartas del XIV Festival Internacional de Cine de Pyongyang.
					Uno de esos afiches tiene dibujadas la insignia del festival y las letras "XIV Festival Internacional de Cine de Pyongyang" y "Bienvenida" y las cintas de 5 colores. 
					
					Da la bienvenida a los amigos del mundo que visitan a Pyongyang, sede del festival, como mensajeros de amistad con el pueblo coreano.
					
					En el otro se leen las palabras como "Independencia", "Paz" y "Amistad", que reflejan el deseo de la humanidad de vivir en un mundo pacifico sin guerras, y se ve una paloma que simboliza la paz.
